# Installation

We recommend installing the stable release version of `PhIPData` in Bioconductor.
This can be done using `BiocManager`:

```{r, eval = FALSE}
if (!require("BiocManager"))
    install.packages("BiocManager")
    
BiocManager::install("PhIPData")
```

To load the package:

```{r, include = TRUE, results = "hide", message = FALSE, warning = FALSE}
#library(PhIPData)
```

# Introduction

The `PhIPData` class is used to store experimental results from phage-immunoprecipitation sequencing (PhIP-Seq) experiments. 

Since the `PhIPData` class extends the [`RangedSummarizedExperiment`](https://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/SummarizedExperiment.html) class, functions for `RangedSummarizedExperiment`/`SummarizedExperiment` object can also be used on `PhIPData` objects. Like `SummarizedExperiment` class, `PhIPData` coordinates metadata and experimental data when subsetting, so sample metadata and assay data remain synced throughout analysis. 

Peptide positions are stored using [`GenomicRanges`](http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/GenomicRanges.html), so subsetting using positional information (via `subsetByOverlaps()`) is supported in the `PhIPData` class. The `PhIPData` package provides additional functionality for subsetting by the virus species from which the peptide sequence was derived. 

# Components of a PhIPData Object

Each `PhIPData` object stores the raw read counts, log10 estimated fold-changes, probabilities associated with enrichment, and metadata associated with the peptides, samples, and experiment.
